headline: Angela's Awesome Enchiladas
description: These awesome chicken enchiladas with Cheddar, olives, and green chiles are well seasoned and super creamy, thanks to sour cream and condensed soup.

video.description: The secret to these savory chicken enchiladas is the seasoning.
video.name: Angela's Awesome Enchiladas

name: Angela's Awesome Enchiladas
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast meat - cut into chunks
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (4 ounce) can chopped green chiles, drained
1 (1.25 ounce) package mild taco seasoning mix
1 (6 ounce) can sliced black olives, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken into a large pot and add water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until chicken is no longer pink and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes.
Remove from the pot and let sit until cool enough to handle, 5 to 10 minutes. Shred chicken with two forks.
Combine sour cream, condensed soup, and chili powder in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer, stirring occasionally, then turn off the heat and cover to keep warm.

At the same time, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add shredded chicken, water, 1/2 of the green onions, green chiles, and taco seasoning; simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in lime juice, onion powder, and garlic powder; simmer for 10 more minutes.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Stir 1 cup soup mixture into the skillet with the chicken. Spread remaining soup mixture over the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Fill each tortilla with 1/5 of the chicken mixture and about 5 tablespoons Cheddar cheese. Roll tortillas around filling and place enchiladas, seam-side down, into the baking dish. Pour enchilada sauce over top and sprinkle with remaining Cheddar, remaining green onions, and olives.
Bake in the preheated oven until filling is heated through and cheese is melted and bubbling, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: It is easier to poach whole breasts (or thighs, if you prefer) and then shred with your hand-mixer. The job is done in about 3 seconds with the mixer technique. I leave out the soup. I make the enchiladas, put in the greased dish, and pour the sauce on.

Delicious! A friend made this first and I stole the recipe üòä. Tip for shredding chicken quickly - in the pot you cook the chicken in, just dump the water and use your hand mixer to shred the chicken (best while chicken is still hot). In seconds your chicken is shredded.

I made a batch of these with flour tortillas and a batch for me (healthier version) by using different tortillas! So good! My son's girlfriend couldn't taste the difference between the two. So easy to make and everyone is happy!
Absolutely declicious as written - no changes needed. So flavorful. Everyone I make these for loves them.
Love these enchiladas. Not too spicy though you could certainly add some jalapenos if that was your taste. Just great comfort food!
This recipe was fantastic! My husband, who's picky and loves Mexican food, thought it was great. Will certainly make again.
We have been making this recipe for years! Always a big hit!
Best enchiladas I've ever made!!
Absolutely delicious!

I have made this recipe dozens of times over the years. Sometimes chicken, sometimes ground beef. Always comes out great. Since moving to Colombia -- there's no canned enchilada sauce here -- I've started making my own. These enchiladas are always a favorite. (Even Colombians like it and they're not big on Mexican food.)
Absolutely awesome!!!!!!
This is the closest recipe to "restaurant quality" that I have ever found. It's awesome and will definitely be my go to recipe when I want enchiladas.
I used chicken from the Salsa Chicken recipe. It turned out great. I did add some garlic and onion powder to the chicken mixture.
I just left out the onions and made the Easy Enchilada Sauce from All Recipes and it turned out great!!!
Really great recipe
This was a hit for my very picky family of 5! It was so good that it's going to be incorporated into our faves that I make on a regular basis.
These ar soooo awesome. Love that you can add or subtract heat as desired.
My family loved it so much that they begged me to make it again.
Awesome recipe! The only thing I did different is that I boiled the chicken breasts in chicken stock then shredded them.
Doubled the recipe and made a batch of green and a batch of red. Also used low carb tortillas and salted the water for boiling the chicken. One of the best things I have ever made!
My go-to for baked enchiladas. The chicken mixture packed a lot of flavor!
No changes except I didn‚Äôt have any green cilantros or green onions but it was still delicious.
These were a big hit with the family, made them as is

These are absolutely amazing. I made a couple of changes from the original recipe. I left out the green onions I don‚Äôt like them, and I used smaller tortillas so it made lots more. Other than that the recipe is just so good. I‚Äôm so thankful that this recipe was shared. You‚Äôre the best!!!!!
i love this recipe i would just cook them for 5 minutes then put the sauce on the put them back in for 20 minutes
Delicious!

Haven't made this yet, but after reading what she said about shredding the chicken was the most time consuming, I got tip for you that will make shredding chicken easy and ready in a snap. Weather you make the chicken yourself or buy it precooked, to shred it quick and practically effortlessly is put it n bowl and use a hand mixer. It shreds the chicken within seconds if the chicken is tender.
The best homemade enchiladas I've ever had! Will definitely make again.
Followed the recipe exactly, except used a pre-cooked, rotisserie chicken to save time. Turned out great!

This was amazing, well I guess it in the name but still! I never made enchiladas before, but this was quite easy. I did cheat and buy shredded chicken from the grocery deli and left out the olives but no changes are necessary. Absolutely perfect the way it is. DO NOT CHANGE ANYTNING!!!

First time making enchiladas and my family loved it. My son said they were the best he has ever had. I did follow what others said about putting the chicken in the slow cooker. It really helped with the time spent cooking. Also, my husband even asked for leftovers the next day. That has never happened.

Excellent recipe. Needed a tad more head for our taste. Doubled the Chile powder and added cayenne pepper seasoning to the filling. With these additions....we found this to be an outstanding recipe. Our friends had seconds and even thirds of this meal!!! It's a winner!
This dish was delicious, didn't have any green chilies, family would prefer none, will be making this again, many times

This recipe is awesome! I am asked to make this at least 10x a year. I follow the recipe as is. Only thing I do different is let the mix cool off some before rolling them. Thanks for sharing this recipe.
The recipe calls for a lot of ingredients but it‚Äôs DELICIOUS
THE BEST! So delicious. Made a large dish with flour tortillas, and a 9x9 with gluten free tortillas. Loved this so much ate the leftovers for lunch 2 times and sent the recipe to every cook I know.

This is a particularly cool recipe. The recipe is a nice starting point, and you can follow it exactly, or make it your own. Leave out the chicken, add black beans, use rotel instead of chilies, forget sour cream, use corn instead of flour tortillas, I‚Äôve done it all. The filling makes enough for a couple of meals and freezes well. It‚Äôs really easy and forgiving if you want to make changes.

I would consider myself an "ok" chef. I don't love to cook so I am absolutely over joyed when I find a recipe like this. My family says that are better than some they have had in restaurants. These are the best enchiladas ever!!!

I have made Angela's recipe for years, this is a family favorite - I probably make this recipe more than any other on Allrecipes. I usually just use a whole rotisserie chicken, and I have made other adjustments depending on what I have in the refrigerator (such as Greek yogurt instead of sour cream). I've also added saut√©ed mushrooms or diced jalapenos - whatever I feel like. I tend to like more heat, so I use hot taco seasoning and hot enchilada sauce. It has never failed me - thanks for the great recipe!!
It's not bad but it's a lot of work. It really took me 1 hour 45 mins from start to finish. I will use my other recipe which is much easier and faster.
this recipe is awesome just like the title says. i use the crockpot hint and i have leftover and freeze for another time. my family loves it. thanks for sharing
Amazing and Delicious!! My family Loved it and that makes it well worth the effort. I highly recommend this recipe. One more Mexican dish to love.

Absolutely delicious! I made this using leftover Thanksgiving turkey and it turned out perfectly! I did however substitute water for homemade turkey stock (always worth it in savory recipes), made a rue to use in lieu of chicken soup concentrate (didn‚Äôt have any), and made the red sauce using another recipe on this site. 10/10, perfect. Thank you for this awesome recipe!

I made this tonight and it was amazing as is! The chicken was very flavorful. One change I will make for next time is to cut the olives in half, just based on my preference, but I still give it 5 stars. It was easy to make and my first (but not last) time making enchiladas.
This was so good and my young kids LOVED it!!!! Will be making this again soon!
Made as directed. Excellent!!! Best in ever had.

My family loves this recipe. I didn't have green chilis so I made it without them this time and they were still delicious! I doubled the portion so I could freeze one dish for another day. I served it with Mexican rice and everyone loved it!
These were so good! Didn't change a thing.
the recipe was amazing me and my roommate loved it!
Aaaaaaamazing!!! These are so good!!!!! Don‚Äôt change a thing. I have also used the filing for chimichangas.
So delicious - followed the recipe as written. Going to try using the crockpot Luke other reviewers have suggested. Can‚Äôt wait to make it again!

I‚Äôm not sure why people choose to tweak tried and true recipes. Made this as instructed, and it is BOMB! A family favorite now! A bit of a ‚Äúgringo‚Äù version of authentic enchiladas, but super tasty just as the recipe calls for. Thank you! A new addition to my recipe box. :)

The family said it was the best enchiladas they have ever tasted.? I don‚Äôt typically eat enchiladas but I enjoyed them too. I used light everything and actually used Greek yogurt instead of sour cream in the soup mix just because I didn‚Äôt have enough sour cream. That was the only change I made. It was perfect!
Easy to make and delicious too. I had a rotisserie chicken so I just shredded that for the recipe. I'd definitely make this again.
No changes needed this is amazing! Every time I make this - everyone asks for the recipe....even my kiddos love it!

Great recipe!! My family and I devoured these enchiladas! I agree with some of the other reviews that said this recipe is a little bland, it can definitely use some spice to it. Overall I thought this recipe was AMAZING!! and I will definitely cook this meal again!
Have made these so many times and everyone loves them. I follow the recipe to the T

Love this creamy version of enchiladas! Thanks for the creative recipe! After making it a few times I now simplify by layering the ingredients like a lasagne, use corn tortillas and bake in 13x9 pan for about 45min.
I did not use the green onion, I used about 3 Tbsp of French Onion dip less sour cream about 3/4 of 16 oz carton. Loved it!!
I used rotel tomato & peppers as a substitute that worked well.

in a word‚Ä¶spectacular! Made it exactly as described and it was a hit with everyone, including my 13 year old picky eater. Keeping this one as II'll be making it again‚Ä¶and again. Thank you for sharing!
family and friends LOVED it the only thing I did different was made my own homemade Cream Soup & Taco Seaonsing. It was a huge hit I will make this again.
love this recipe!! Have made it many times and it's always a winner. So good!!!
Next time I‚Äôll use maybe 1 1/2 pounds of chicken. My baking dish holds 10‚Äù tortillas better, and I can get 6 enchiladas instead of 5. This is really a terrific recipe!
Great Recipe! I made it exactly as directed, no adjustments or substitutions needed.
didn't make any changes and it was a huge hit, will definitely be making this again
I will make it again. It takes a least two hours to get it to the finish but well worth it!
Spot on! This recipe is a keeper
I made this just as the recipe said and it was delicious !!! My family loved it. This recipe is definitely a keeper.
This recipe was fantastic! a keeper for sure.

SurprisEd at how good this came out. Kids loved this, it‚Äôs a keeper in our house. I‚Äôll probably instapot the chicken next time to save time. My only modifications were to use chicken thighs, I added salt to the chicken filling and then I left of the canned olives.
I've tried tons of enchilada recipes, several I have liked, but none that my husband preferred over a Mexican restaurant until this one! A keeper for sure!
too mushy

This was very delicious. I had to use some substitutions based on what I had in my pantry- but even those made this tasty yummy. I did make this as a layered casserole as based on another users suggestion. It was so easy to dish out.
Delicious
Wow! Made tonight, exactly as recipe said, saved a little enchilada sauce to serve on top.

This has got to be one of the BEST meals I have ever made. I plan for it to be the first dish I make for company after the pandemic. I read reviews that said that enchiladas do not have chicken soup, this was bland etc. absolutely not true for us, it made the dish spectacular. I made the tray for my husband as written, the only change I made was added a generous dash of cumin to the chicken mixture. (For myself I suffer from chronic heartburn so in another dish I filled 3 tortillas with the chicken mixture with cheese as directed and topped with some of the reserved soup/sour cream mixture, and leftover chicken mixture and finally cheese. Not sure which one tasted better with or without the enchilada sauce, I think mine was but my hubby thought his was either was this was fantastic, I highly recommend it.
More spices. Added cumin to meat. Added fresh chopped jalapenos. Added cilantro to cream of chicken and sour cream mixture. Used pepper jack cheese instead of cheddar.
These were the best enchiladas I have ever had!!! They were a nice twist to the regular enchiladas!!! My family loved them. I would highly recommend them!
My husband is Mexican, and I never make authentic food because it doesn't compare to his mom's cooking. But he LOVED this, we all did! So easy to make, and the sauce was the best part
This is one of my favorite recipes on this app. I use the Costco packaged rotisserie chicken chunks and shred them. I fill a few with just cheese and the filling. So good!

My family loves this recipe. This is not a dish that produces leftovers in our house. I cheated and laid the (homemade) tortillas out lasagna-style so that our little one didn‚Äôt end up wearing her dinner, and it was perfect. So flavourful, and it looks great!

This was excellent! I did make it Covid-19 style which means lots of substitutions since I am trying to use what I have. I encourage you to try it even if you don't have 'everything'. 
*I subbed a can of black beans and a small can of chicken for the protein
*I saut√©ed a bell pepper in with the onion
*I subbed Rotel in for green chilies and used straight tomato sauce instead of enchilada sauce
*I used 6" tortillas (7 of them)
*I accidentally used cream of mush rather then cream of chicken--LOL

Ohhhh Soooo Good! A bit labor intensive but this is my 1st time ever making chicken enchiladas. Next time I'm going to try "shredding" chicken in food processor. 
Recipe easily handles 3-4x the chili powder and subbing jalapenos for green chilies.
We loved this recipe!!!
Delicious

These chicken enchiladas tasted better than I had expected. They were delicious! Very tasty! Even my husband kept saying "These are really good" over and over as he was eating them! Thank you Angela for the new recipe! And thank you to Allrecipes!!!
This recipes is delicious and my family loves it. They are excited any time I make them - never gets old. Definitely recommend them.

I made it following the recipe and it was delicious. My family loved them even my pickiest water! The only thing I Did differently was that I used 12 corn tortillas instead of flour. I fried the tortillas in a little oil for about a minute so that they would not rip when I rolled them up. Thanks for the recipe.

I love this recipe and I had to substitute a bit I made my cream of chicken and use buttermilk ranch instead of cream of tarter. I really didn't know the cream of chicken is so easy to make and it takes a dollar or three of the budget. I love it I so glad to be apart of the Allrecipes family and I am glad my COVID -19 dinner came out great I also paired it with a garlic parsley cheese rice because my youngest waNTED CHEESE cheese cheese so it a great cheese night thank you
This recipe really was Awesome! The family loved it, it was easy to make, and the presentation was excellent!
Oh my this was amazing. Thank You!
Made this exactly according to the recipe and it was a huge hit for our cinco de mayo party. A definite do over. Thank you!

I have made these enchiladas of Angela‚Äôs for years now. I get asked to make them all the time. I‚Äôm pretty sure these enchiladas helped me snag my husband hehe. Thank you Angela. Best enchiladas on the planet.
I loved it! So much flavor! I doubled the ingredients to make a bigger batch.

Followed it to the letter, except for the tortilla size. This is a restaurant quality dish and the house smelled yummy for hours afterwards. I used six 8" flour tortillas instead of five 12" ones. Served it with Mexican rice, chips and salsa. This is Mexican comfort food and the last touches to make it a perfect meal are the Margaritas - cheers!

This was really good! Added chopped jalape√±os and stacked the tortillas like a lasagna another person suggested. I cooked the chicken in a crock pot too. Will definitely make again. I guess you could add some other ingredients to the crock pot to make it quicker. So good- thank you!!!
Awesome ! The leftovers were just as good they were gone in no time ! Thank you !
good but I have a picker eater
